website_summaries.verdict: Shoppers looking for a simple, inexpensive headphone stand will appreciate this product's no-nonsense design with key features.
pros: Constructed with an aluminum bar for long-lasting strength and support
Includes no-slip rubber grips on the bottom of the product
Customers rave over the product's flexible headphone rest, which keeps headphones from creasing or bending
cons: Customers wish the entire product were made of aluminum, rather than just the supporting bar

customer_reviews.title: From first impressions, there great!
customer_reviews.text: Packaging was simple, sweet and came with complimentary items that are neat. It was super easy to put together, as in no effort at all and works as promoted. Gotta see over time how it holds up but as for now, if you want to display your headsets in a neat, compact way is convenient for the customer, then I recommend this product. See photos as I got two of them. Also writing this review again because of Amazon thought
customer_reviews.author: Brian W. Britt

customer_reviews.title: Worked Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to keep the headphones on my desk from getting thrown around or from getting stuff piled on them. This is a very sturdy device. The unit feels very light like it wouldn't stand up with headphones on it, but it is deceptively stable. The base feels like light plastic while the stand portion feels heavier (metal). The top is made of rubber to give the headphone a good grip. Overall I am extremely pleased with this item. UPDATE: Since this review I have purchased 2 more of these...
customer_reviews.author: D. Porrey

customer_reviews.title: Great steal
customer_reviews.text: The quality is actually pretty great for the price. The height is a bit smaller than i expected but i just collapse my headset before resting it on there and it doesn't touch the desk. The top is flexible rubber/plastic type material which is gentle on the headband and doesn't slip, and the shaft is hard metal (aluminum?) and sturdy. The base provides great stability and good grip. Comes in 3 simple pieces. I threw out the free gifts they sent, but appreciate the sentiment :) Pretty flawless for the ridiculous price. Aesthetics look sleek/low profile and take up minimal desk space. Great steal.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Kosmatka

customer_reviews.title: Looks great on my desk
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery, easy assembly, does its job. Lovely box, and as a gift a thank you card and an adhesive stand for my cell phone. I don't think the adhesive stand is gonna come off my phone but it's really handy so I don't mind. To note, not added in the description there are pads on the bottom of the stand that keep it from sliding. This was a good surprise and a plus for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphone Stand at a Fair Price
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good set of headphone stand, with a great price. Searched a bit on Amazon for a nice stand and finally settled on this one. I got a winner here, great functionality, great price, I'm sold. It holds my Audio-Technica ATH-M50x pretty well, save for the left earcup which is a bit elevated due to where the cable connects. Not a deal breaker though. Double thumbs up! I may get another one.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Not the nicest, but probably the best for the cost
customer_reviews.text: Not a lot to say about this. Nice, sturdy stand. Incredibly easy to assemble and holds the headphones just like you want them to. Definitely not as nice as some others out there, but for the cost, it's the best option.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: I honestly love this little headphone stand!
customer_reviews.text: I honestly love this little headphone stand. I spent weeks looking around Amazon for a stand for my headphones and they all had their pluses and minuses. I finally found this this little baby and it was very inexpensive and totally does the Job well and is nicely understated so it finds it's place on your desk, table etc. without being overwhelming or gaudy. This does the job it was made to do and does it well. I'm using it with an expensive Bose quiet comfort bluetooth around the ear headphones. Would recommend and definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Osherow

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my bayerdynamic DT 770 Pro
customer_reviews.text: Does the job and it's excellent for the price! Things that matter: Easy to setup. There are just 3 pieces. Doesn't really need any instructions. Just attach the long end to the base and then the actual mount on the other end. The mount is flexible and made of soft rubber thingy - which is pretty good. Secondly, the base is non-slip and is pretty stable on my table. Lastly, it's sturdy enough to support my bayerdynamic DT 770 Pro. So, overall, it's a good deal. Oh, and I got the white/silver one over the black one. And it does go well with the contrasting black of the DT 770Pro. Hope this helps!
customer_reviews.author: Trishul

customer_reviews.title: They look nice - very professional
customer_reviews.text: I bought these since it stands for my office as we're moving over to a computer-based telephony system and need a place to put the headsets so as not to clutter the desks. I looked at headsets stands in the past for myself always been very expensive for what they are. And the ones that I've look that have been very bulky. These are low profile very inexpensive yet solidly built – in my situation they are exactly what I need - very simple get's the job done. They look nice - very professional.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Successfully keeps the earpads out of coffee spills
customer_reviews.text: Barely, but the pads aren't polishing the desktop any longer. This stand is entirely adequate at the price point. I really don't know about expectations for a product like this when you're spending less than 10 bucks. The rectangular ABS base is flat and reasonably stable, the aluminum upright fits securely into the upper and lower slots and the ABS support doesn't inflict any damage to the headband on any of my sets. If I had paid more attention when ordering I might have noticed the height is a tad less than I might have desired for a set of JBL gaming headphones but that's on me, not the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: mateo52

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Great Price
customer_reviews.text: No frills but sturdy, stable, no sliding around (rubber feet under base), soft cradle for headpad. Simple elegance in design and construction. Only beef--but I live with it--is pillar is a bit short for my headphones with cups adjusted to my head. The cables therefore are bent 90deg close to the cups. I mitigate this by putting holder right next to desk edge and placing phones so cables can make gentle bend over the desk edge. I have to turn them 180 every time I remove or put them on, but not a big deal for the great price.
customer_reviews.author: WAnderson

customer_reviews.title: Does the job - Molded plastic base and Tee Top
customer_reviews.text: These headphone stands do the job well, they hold up a fairly heavy set of Audio-Technica headphones well and high enough. My only issue is that the stand is on the light side which makes it a two handed operation to place the headphones onto the stand. While the vertical support is made of aluminum (which is very good) the base is a piece of molded plastic that is too light. Once the headphones are on the stand, it is stable, but to put the headphones on, you need to hold it up. Not really an issue, but may effect heavier headphones. I took away one star for that, but overall, this is a good headphone stand.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Good inexpensive headphone stand
customer_reviews.text: It's an inexpensive headphone stand with a plastic base, aluminum center section, and soft rubber top. Perfect for my (non-audiophile) headphones. Does exactly what I was looking for, at the price I was willing to pay. Very happy with the product!
customer_reviews.author: ilovetofu

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for any desk or office space
customer_reviews.text: I love this. I own some pretty expensive headphones and I needed to find something that I could use to put them on versus laying them on the desk all the time. I spent $300 for these and they honestly, should be displayed and cared for. Great support at top for placing, lengthy is perfect and its black so matches in with me desk nicely. Has rubber spots on the bottom of it so it won't scratch the desk or surface. Stays in place and very starry. Enough room as well to plug in to charge at the bottom with a cord. It is not wobbly at all. Best investment I ever bought.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: good headphone stand. A heavier stand would have made this better.
customer_reviews.text: The design and material used are okay. The part where the headphone sits on is made of a rubbery material that will not scratch your headphones. The vertical piece is made of metal and will not break or bend. The base is made of plastic. the base is very lightweight due to the plastic. When grabbing your headphone you have to pull the ear cups a little apart before pulling off the stand. Otherwise brushing the stand will cause it to tip over. A heavier base would have helped keep the stand in place. I would have paid a few dollars more for a better stand.
customer_reviews.author: DYC

customer_reviews.title: Holds headphones, but doesn't feel particularly high quality
customer_reviews.text: The part in contact with the table and the headphones is flimsy plastic, the pole is a metallic substance. It doesn't feel particularly high quality, but it gets the job done. It has the name of the company embossed in huge letters in the base, but I turned that backwards so I'm not staring at it. Fits my Sony WH-1000XM3 and keeps them off of my desk. I'll probably look for something more aesthetically pleasing with a heavier base (this one seems very easy to tip over), but it gets the job done for now.
customer_reviews.author: J M

customer_reviews.title: Wobbles far too much
customer_reviews.text: I use a convertible standing desk, and while this stand might work well on a fixed desk that doesn't get bumped, if the desk moves, this things is all over the place. While it is quite functional, the lack of a weighted base or any form of adhesive means that if it gets bumped or the desk moves, you get wobbling and tipping. For a solid desk that doesn't experience any movement or any bumping of the stand, this stand will work well.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Decent headphone stand
customer_reviews.text: This headphone stand is packaged well and includes the stand, an unrelated phone holder and a nicer quality microfiber cleaning cloth. The stand is made of three parts that are just inserted together to make it complete, a hard plastic base with rubber feet for skid resistance, an aluminum body and a hard foam top piece. Setup only takes about 2-3 minutes and once put together the stand is reasonably well balanced and holds the headphones well. Overall not a bad buy for the price paid.
customer_reviews.author: Troy L.

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to assemble and use, plus some extras
customer_reviews.text: The box is small, and inside is a plastic molded form that hold the three stand pieces. The pieces fit perfectly for assembly. The box included a small gray cloth for cleaning, folded in quarters. And also included was a small packet with a cellphone ring that is attached to the cell case back for holding in the hand (inserting a finger in the ring), and as a simple cellphone stand. The main headphone stand is simple as it should be to protect the ear cups from touching each other or to any surface. It does the job well!
customer_reviews.author: Raymond J. Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Quick, simple headphone stand
customer_reviews.text: Great product, with a very simple design. The materials are okay, but as a simple stand, they are perfect, because no one is going to use this in a fight or anything. I would recommend the black version instead of the white which I had purchased, because the full construction is not white, the vertical bar itself is a aluminium brushed paint, which looks like it can be scratched easily, and the construction seems flimsy when putting it together, but the pricing and the simple aesthetic use of it makes it a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Lui

customer_reviews.title: Nice Stand
customer_reviews.text: Like the stand very much. This stand was easy to put together, the pole slots into the base and the top bit slots in the pole, made up from three parts. It is sturdy enough to hold my old afterglow headset, I am thinking of buying another one for a friend.
customer_reviews.author: myko

customer_reviews.title: At least it does its job
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine headphone stand and does what it is intended to do. However, the feet do not grip the desk and I do not like the horizontal arch of the perch (where the headset makes contact with the stand). After having some experience with this stand, I will be shopping for an RGB stand with a smaller area to hang the headset. Honestly, I liked my stand that clips on the desk with a hook that swivels better than this product. On the other hand, if you are not picky then this stand will do it's job.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan M Cox

customer_reviews.title: Yikes
customer_reviews.text: This headphone stand would be great if it were an inch taller. If you notice in the pictures, it doesn't show a cord connected to the headphones. With a cord, it would touch the foundation and create pressure on the cord and it would force you headphones to be lopsided. I have tried this with Beyerdynamic DT 990s and Philips X2HR headphones and both do not fit on this stand. Do not buy this stand if you plan on putting headphones on it with a cord attached at the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Cole

customer_reviews.title: Good stand for 9 bucks.
customer_reviews.text: My Grado SR225 headphones now have a home. This is a basic construction, all in black with mixed materials. The cradle is a rubber-like material, the shaft is metal and the base is plastic. They are all about the same basic black color. The headphones sit nicely and the overall construction is pretty good. Hey, it's inexpensive and does the job and looks pretty good. What else can you ask for. My rating is based on the fact this costs 9 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: keeps my headphones off the floor
customer_reviews.text: I goth this because I am working from home and don't have a lot of space - this keeps the headphones off the floor and where i can get to them when i need to make a call. the stand has a small foot print and is sturdy enough- just wish the base had a little more weight to it so it does not move when i remove the headphones. All and all great little item and easy to put together and got a phone ring holder thingy as a free gift.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: I loved it!
customer_reviews.text: Now, let's face it this product is not created to be handle by clumsy hands or people with an aggressive way of handling things. The top part at least it is very fragile but it worth the money. If you treat it right just to hang it when is not in use, then, this product will work for you. However, if you can admit that you are kind of clumsy or you have not well-behaved children, I suggest you do not buy this product. Other than that I think this product is a very good product and I loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: i really dislike this product
customer_reviews.text: you are paying $10 for a thin sleeve of plastic parts that fits together like a bosslewood toy plane that is 1000% pure profit for these guys and will tip over with a sneeze. Bring down the price a couple a bucks as this is even beyond particle-board cheap Furrino furniture kinds of manufacturing expoitation. All this thing does is slide around and irritate and enrage the senses.
customer_reviews.author: Social Justice

customer_reviews.title: Simple and cost effective
customer_reviews.text: It's honestly a simple way to ensure your headset is secure. I would have liked it even more if there was more metal construction in the base but it still holds everything securely and neatly. For a heavier and more professional headset you would probably want to go for a larger and more heavily constructed stand. This will do for most chat and gaming sets.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly cheap feeling
customer_reviews.text: I guess this is a "I don't know what I expected" sort of situation. This product is very cheap feeling, and makes me wonder if I should have built my own headphone stand out of objects around the house. Without a metal base, it feels like it may topple at any moment. It advertises being usable with Sennheiser HD650, and simply is not- the cables are crimped as they hit the base. It just isn't tall enough. All around, this is junk.
customer_reviews.author: Brooklyn Bound

customer_reviews.title: Decent but not tall enough.
customer_reviews.text: It's a decent headphone stand IF your headphones are the right size. My HyperX Cloud II headset barely fits on it without touching the desk, after fully shortening the length of the cups. This is annoying but not a big deal. I returned it because the cord on my headset comes out the bottom of one cup. This puts serious strain on the wire to bend right out of the cup. I want my expensive headset to last a long time, so this headphone stand had to go. It's a decent product, just not right for me.
customer_reviews.author: Hayley

customer_reviews.title: Good Stand
customer_reviews.text: It is not super bulky which I love as it does not stick out like a sore thumb. Holds so many different types of headphones/headsets which is super nice as I have multiple different brands and types. Sturdy. Good quality rubber at the top which bends with the headband bend of the headset which then prevents your headphones from stretching out or breaking. Good Stand. Good Stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Squeakachu

customer_reviews.title: Simple yet effective
customer_reviews.text: Welp, it's really basic and does what it's suppose to do. The base is plastic, the stem is metal, and the top headphone holder is flexible plastic (all of which could probably scratch easy). It's very light but can hold my Bose 35QC ii firmly. It has four rubber bits at the bottom to prevent it from sliding. Happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: StarvMarv

customer_reviews.title: wonderful little stand
customer_reviews.text: i have some wall-mounted headphone "hooks" for a couple pairs i have, but lacked one for my daily drivers (ath-ad2000x). so i made the jump and purchased this. they work well if i place my headphones with a bit of care since these particular headphones have a different sort of head-rest positioned peddles or whatever. i placed the stand on top of my tower which happens to be black, so visually when i place my headphones on them it all looks nice and neat. i also enjoy the little thank you card as well as the complimentary microfiber cloth and phone ring.
customer_reviews.author: Cam K

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my desk nice and tidy
customer_reviews.text: I got this headphone stand to kind of help keep my desk nice and clean looking, I absolutely love the look of my headset on these. This stand is very cheap but still delivers great quality for the price. assembly was made super easy straight out of the box. You always receive a New Bee pop socket and cleaning rag. Very nice of them to include a little gift for this price. I would recommend if you're looking for something simple to just help keep your desk looking neatly organized.
customer_reviews.author: Jurne Molina

customer_reviews.title: Perfect stand for my Beats 3 headphones
customer_reviews.text: I wanted my Beats studio 3 headphones to be on my desk where I can get it easily. I wanted a nice stand that was simple and stylish. This was it. I added this stand on my new desk next to my Mac and it looks great. It fits perfectly with everything else on the desk and is quite sturdy. Great price for the stand. Definitely recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Joey L

customer_reviews.title: Simple no fuss headphone organizer.
customer_reviews.text: Keeps my headphones safe and clean by keeping them off of the table. Makes my desk look more organized. I bought three and will buy more as my headphone collection grows. These are the simple no fuss way to organize your headphones. I can even have my headphones plugged in and charging while on the stand. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Great way to store and display your favorite headset!
customer_reviews.text: This stand is great! My 4 person family are all gamers. Three of us are multiplayer gamers, so we all have headsets for each console. I bought 2 of these at Christmas 2019. They work great! They are compact (small) in size, and do not take up space. They are made entirely of plastic. They have rubber padding on the bottom to keep it from moving around on smooth surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Wraith6750

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: Works fine for the most part. The stand itself is plastic with 4 rubber feet on the bottom. The top where the headphones sit is a soft plastic that bends kind of easily. The thing I don't like about this stand is that it has no heft: it falls over easily if my headphones catch on any part of it when setting them down or removing them.
customer_reviews.author: djsh4dowfan

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: This was an ok item. Decent/low price. I did not like that the top rest if I did not hang my headphones just right would leave a crease in the padding. Same goes for the tall rod portion, it would leave the earcups creased. I returned to try other alternatives. Had I not purchased higher end headphones I would have stayed with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Jason Ibarra

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and functional
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this stand for my Steelseries Arctic 7 Headphones. It holds them comfortably. The stand itself is very lightweight and can tip over pretty easy when placing and removing headphones, but this could easily be solved by anchoring it to the desk with some adhesive or a clamp. Otherwise, you can't beat the price!
customer_reviews.author: Krystal

customer_reviews.title: Exactly  as described!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this headset stand for my son he loves it taken him less than 2 minutes to assemble nothing to it. He loves the extra gifts that came with it!! Fits his needs perfect! Perfect for his gaming headset! Shipping was SUPER FAST TOO THANKS TO MY PRIME! received a day early I will be purchasing a silver one for myself!
customer_reviews.author: Hotttam

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: Save your money and get a better headphone stand. This thing is pure junk. The top piece you hang the headphones on is a cheap piece of thin rubber. No quality...
customer_reviews.author: WESSEC

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: I guess I didn’t expect much for the price, but I have to admit that I’m very pleased with this. It’s inexpensive and does exactly what I need it to do. I was actually a bit impressed that it doesn’t feel cheap. It has a solid base plastic base and aluminum pole, which are extremely easy to put together and fit just right. The silicon flexible top is clever, and snaps in easily too. All in all, I would absolutely buy this again and recommend it to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Well made, great way to keep headphones from getting broken
customer_reviews.text: These are really great. My 11yr old son is not great with putting stuff away and has broken plenty of headsets In the past, so I bought these when I got him an expensive turtle beach headset in the hopes he’d take care of them. Well it’s been a few months now and he thinks the stand is so cool he hangs them back up every night, so super happy I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: monica

customer_reviews.title: This stand is great. It's very sturdy for being so thin and ...
customer_reviews.text: This stand is great. It's very sturdy for being so thin and cheap. The rubber top conforms to my headset well. It's fallen off my desk a few times because general clumsiness and cats, but it hasn't broken. It can be easily secured to Command strips, I imagine, but I like to be able to move it or brandish it at my cats when they are being jerks.
customer_reviews.author: Cin

customer_reviews.title: Stand is inexpensive but the base is so light it just gets in the way & makes it hard to use
customer_reviews.text: Like I said. Stand is very cheap but that means it's so light that when you try to take your headphones off the stand it's a NIGHTMARE to take off your headphones without knocking it over and causing all sorts of problems. BUY A HIGHER QUALITY ONE WITH A HEAVIER BASE!
customer_reviews.author: Rndy The Misbehave

customer_reviews.title: Neatens up my desk area for a great price, decent quality
customer_reviews.text: This is actually a pretty decent stand to hold the headset. The top piece stays on just fine and does the job. This might must just be me being picky, but a slightly larger base could be helpful. Not a deal breaker and certainly does the job. The headset I have is large for gaming with a mic.
customer_reviews.author: TerryU

customer_reviews.title: It broke with assembly. Returning.
customer_reviews.text: This broke as soon as I attempted assembly, which is pretty basic. You slip the tube on the base and in the part that actually holds the headphones. The tube is sturdy, but the base is very cheap plastic. The external part of the base where the tube slips on immediately snapped off, reversing this useless.
customer_reviews.author: astraight

customer_reviews.title: Material just okay
customer_reviews.text: I expected this holder to be better as far as the reviews were. But, it was away from my expectation. The material wasn’t really good . You can easily break it with your hands if you want. But, overall it’s just okay but I am pretty sure there are better products out in the market.
customer_reviews.author: Arman Bhandari

customer_reviews.title: Too light
customer_reviews.text: The stand is too light. Specifically, its base does not have any counterweight in it. As a result, it does not hold its position when a headphone is placed on it. It is very easy for this stand to get knocked over, simply because of the small base and the lack of counterweight.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Hu

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but good quality
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive but it works nicely. I was worried it'd be too small but it's just right for both my wired g635 and wireless g933. The base is plastic, the shaft is real aluminum and the top is a bendy rubber. It was easy to assemble (3 pieces) and doesn't bend or anything. The top part is rubber so it's designed to bend to conform to your headband. I like it. It's clean and simple.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Robichaud

customer_reviews.title: Good grip
customer_reviews.text: My son was looking for somewhere to put his gaming headphones after he was done. This is simple and hands rub her feet which help hold it in place and then the grip is wide enough to hold his large gaming headset. I’m happy with it I just need to get my son to clean up and use it more often.
customer_reviews.author: NCGaston

customer_reviews.title: Nothing awesome.
customer_reviews.text: I used these for my Steelseries Arctis Wireless headset. There's nothing special about these. If you want sturdiness, then maybe spend a little more. I don't need these anymore, because I have a gaming desk that holds headsets. I gave this to my 5 year old daughter...
customer_reviews.author: Shlomo

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Looks great with my HyperX Cloud Alpha headset on it. Tall enough to hold it without unplugging the wire and/or adjusting the sizing/fit of the headset. I worried a bit about how sturdy it would be, but it stays in place nicely and doesn't feel like it will fall over easily. Though I'm not sure if the plastic piece that pushes into the metal bar would hold up if accidently knocked off the desk. I would still recommend though, as for the price, the stand is great!
customer_reviews.author: MDN

customer_reviews.title: the pole thing is the only metal part and its really not that good quality. but it does work quite well
customer_reviews.text: the base and the part the headphones rest on are plastic. the pole thing is the only metal part and its really not that good quality. but it does work quite well. if you dont mind the fact the the only metal in this product is the pole, then go ahead and get it, it works perfectly fine and it solid. my ath-m50x almost touch the base of the stand and i csnt put them on the stand with my bal-m50x added on. so id skip this one and look for something taller and better looking thats completely made of metal.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: You get what you're looking for here!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a sturdy headphone stand and that's exactly what I got! The price point was beyond reasonable, and the quality surpassed that by heaps and bounds. The one thing I liked most about this stand is that it's simple to put together, making it perfect for travel. This is EXACTLY what it appears to be and then some!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Street Cafe

customer_reviews.title: Short
customer_reviews.text: I was not expecting anything super well built for the price but I was upset when the height of the stand is almost the same as my headphones. My headphones barely fit on this stand and the cable is almost touching the surface of my desk. I am using audio technica ath-m40x's which are not large by any means and they are still too small for the stand. Additionally the rubber that holds your headphones in place is far too firm and should be more flexible to properly hold headphones without leaving a mark on the headband
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: best investments
customer_reviews.text: You don’t need to spend on a expensive stand when you have this stand at this price, it is Very easy to set up, and light weight. I bought three of this, two for my house and one for my office to keep both of my headphones protected and dust free, get this if you own expensive headphones and you want to protect them.
customer_reviews.author: juan

customer_reviews.title: Really nice minimal looking headset stand, sturdy not too wobbly, and fits my GIANT Corsair headset.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice looking basic headset stand, my Corsair VOID Pro RGB fits nicely on it, and it's a fairly large headset. Only gripe would be that the base is plastic, but it is sturdy, and it has a GIANT "New Bee" indent logo on it, which kind of takes away from it's really nice minimal look.
customer_reviews.author: Livid J...

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice stand! I didn’t pay attention to the fact that the silver stand is only silver on the post and the other pieces are white; I thought the whole stand would be silver. Coincidentally, it worked out and matched my headphones perfectly haha :). Great price for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Shopper

customer_reviews.title: simple but great
customer_reviews.text: Two pieces, easily assembled, nice sleek design and super affordable. It doesn't have the "cool" changing lights, but it didn't cost 60 bucks either. It's exactly what I wanted and a step up from just throwing them somewhere on my desk. I purchased one that sticks under my desk and it was such an awkward habit that never caught on, I'm glad I have this now. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: Didn't expect a whole lot from this stand given the price, but it's quite unimpressive. It's so short, both of my pairs of studio headphones touch the table when they rest on the stand (HIFIMAN 4xx and Sennheiser 58x). At least it stays put for the most part. Pretty weak overall, though.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Neat, but be wary of size and your cable
customer_reviews.text: It's a neat little stand. But my HyperX Cloud Alphas had a difficult time getting on the stand, as the cable was rubbing against the base of the stand too much. My headset has a detachable cable, but it's a pain to remove once it's attached to the headset. But I gave this to someone who has a pair of wireless Turtle Beach Stealth 500Ps and it fits perfectly fine on the stand. Just keep in mind that your pair of headphones aren't too large so it's cable doesn't wear out against the base of the stand. So, you're perfectly fine if your pair of cans are wireless or conveniently have a detachable cable.
customer_reviews.author: PrototypeTec

customer_reviews.title: Great headphone stand for your headphones to stand
customer_reviews.text: It comes in a very compact packaging which is great. Easy to assemble and feels really sturdy. Love that the main arm is metal and that the part where you put the headphones is a soft rubberish material. I feel that it looks better than the clamps that goes on the edge of your desk.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: Minimalistic headset stand.
customer_reviews.text: I love minimal design and the all black blends in well if you have an all black desktop set up. The only con I could think of is their branding on the base of the stand. I'd prefer if it was on the bottom of the base so that it'll look cleaner. The soft plastic where the headset rests holds up well when it seems flimsy. Very sturdy, and great stand for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Horatio

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT work well with Bose 700
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this stand along with Bose 700's. The curve of the stand is nearly non-existent and is not compatible with the leather headband for the Bose 700's (
customer_reviews.author: grammiecolorstoo

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: This product does what it is intended to do and that's hold your head phones and does it perfectly. There's practically no weight to the stand so it will move around when picking it up but it's fine when setting it down and perfectly balanced. I think it's worth the purchase for the price I bought it for but I will eventually upgrade to Razer's Base Station Chroma as it appears to have a heavy weight to it, which keeps even the wires from moving it around.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Wobbly out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting the highest quality out of the box but I at least expected the bottom to be flat. Out of the box it is wobbly - the base plate is warped and won't sit flat. A very irritating little thing but it causes the whole stand to be unusable for me.
customer_reviews.author: HunterB

customer_reviews.title: Broke during assembly.
customer_reviews.text: Product broke while I was putting it together, I barely applied any pressure whatsoever and it snapped. Waste of my money.
customer_reviews.author: Jake P.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Stand
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to put my gaming headset on next to my computer. It works well and is sturdy. I don't believe it is adhesive, so I'm not sure why that is listed as a feature, but does have flexible non slip stoppers on the bottom to stop it from moving on the desk, so that is a nice feature. The price was very reasonable. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: Sixtus

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I saw a review for a $100 headphone stand and thought, "Hey I need a headphone stand, surely there are cheaper models." I found this one—delighted with the price—and figured what the heck? It's PERFECT. The base is somewhat weighted and the stand is sturdy. The size is just right and my Sony MDR7506 fits perfectly. Now, I'm laughing all the way to the bank.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Factory Defect with Poor Plastic Molds
customer_reviews.text: I'd give it 1.5 stars because of the price. Mine came to me as a factory defect where none of the parts that need to be assembled will fit properly together. Meaning both sides stick out about a quarter of an inch because of excess plastic on both sides making the stand unstable and unusable. If I wanted to waste my time I could cut away the extra material to make it fit but a 9 dollar product shouldn't need 15 minutes of fitment because someone doesn't know how to make plastics molds.
customer_reviews.author: Polyblank

customer_reviews.title: Not fully aluminum, base part is made from cheap plastic
customer_reviews.text: Misleading description, only the stick connector is made from aluminum but it doesn’t feel solid, everything else are lightweight, cheap plastic. Parts can’t be assembled tight, it doesn’t really fit. Add couple of bucks and buy solid aluminum stand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid headphone stand to complete the look!
customer_reviews.text: I really didn't think I needed a headphone stand till I actually made the purchase for one. Just seeing my QC35 on the stand is a great look. This is a simple stand that comes in 3 pieces. The top piece is made of a solid yet flexible material while the neck and base is made out of aluminum. As an added surprise... It came with a New Bee finger phone ring inside the box! Overall... I would buy another one for my other headphone. Definitely worth the price. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: drklbc

customer_reviews.title: They work...
customer_reviews.text: This stand is sturdy enough to hold the headphones I have. I ended up buying three of them based on the positive reviews written about them. I have a set of audio-technica ATH-M30x, Corsair HS50(not pictured), and Sentey gaming headphones. They worked as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Logan12

customer_reviews.title: Plastic base.. really?
customer_reviews.text: I thought the base would be made out of metal but it was plastic. The stand is barely tall enough to hang my Bose headphones. The part I don't like is that my headphone earpieces press against the aluminum neck of the stand causing the earpieces to deform a little bit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Prime Fanatic

customer_reviews.title: Falls over a lot
customer_reviews.text: It does what it’s supposed to: hold my headphones. But one big problem I have is that the base is way too light. Anytime I take my headphones off of it, it falls over. If I tap it on accident, it falls over. The material is sturdy so it hasn’t broken yet.
customer_reviews.author: Monster

customer_reviews.title: Simple and affordable
customer_reviews.text: This is a reasonably sturdy stand, very well priced and it does its job right. It is not by any means a bomb proof stand. So unless you want to drill some holes and screw it down into your desk you'll need to keep cats, dogs, lizards, birds or any other wildlife off your desk.
customer_reviews.author: R. Vega

customer_reviews.title: Great and affordable product
customer_reviews.text: Received my stand and it was super easy to set up, sturdy, looks good, they included a lens cleaning wipe, and a custom pop socket type device. They seem to be very appreciative of their customers and it’s a good product for a very reasonable price. Will be ordering a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Russell bates

customer_reviews.title: Looks great
customer_reviews.text: This stand is good for the money, what can make it better would have been a heavy base to stay in place it’s very light just enough to tip over or wobble around while removing the headset. But for the price and the sleek look they are worth the few bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Jojo515

customer_reviews.title: Keep your gaming equipment safe!
customer_reviews.text: This headphone stand has come in very handy. I have a little gamer at home who used his own money to buy a new gaming headset. The stand keeps it from being placed in a heap or possibly damaged. It’s very simple but does just what it should.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa C.

customer_reviews.title: Most impressive; could even use to hang a China virus mask
customer_reviews.text: Very well packaged with some unadvertised extras. Material looks impressive, gives appearance of metal but is a synthetic plastic of some kind. Grips the desk well with no sliding. Attractively priced. All around an excellent buy.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Web

customer_reviews.title: Not quite tall enough for my headphones when plugged in.
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a great stand for a great price but...it is a little short for my Hs70 pro wireless headphones. I wish it were an inch or so taller. As is, the headphones fit when not charging. However when I plug the charging cable in there is some pressure on the cord as the headphones charge because it is a bit short. Other than that, it is a great stand. I would look for a talker one if I had another chance though.
customer_reviews.author: Regular guy

customer_reviews.title: Works for wireless headsets
customer_reviews.text: I bought this stand with the intention of using it for my wired gaming headset. It is tall enough for the headset itself, however, it is not tall enough to allow the chord from the headset adequate space. I would only recommend using this with a wireless headset, if the chord comes out the bottom of your headset it will hit the desk and prevent this from functioning properly. Also, it's pretty light. I could see it tipping over fairly easily.
customer_reviews.author: RDC Wilson

customer_reviews.title: not really sturdy
customer_reviews.text: ive had this for a few months and i have to say i dont really use it. Its basically a plastic stick with a not so sturdy base. it doesnt really fit my Razor headset at all....almost tips over whenever i put them on it.....
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: - Was easy to put together, required no tools. - Fits all of my headsets. (Hifiman Sundara and Philips X2HR for example) - One star deducted because the base needs a bit more weight, once the headphone is off it's easy to knock this thing over since it is light as a feather but the money paid for this thing it is what it is.
customer_reviews.author: MasterMike

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: First off if you have a wired headset I don't really recommend. THE only problem I have with this is that the design on top can grab on the headrest of my headphones and I feel like it will wear out the cushion and rip it so I don't use it anymore. I would say look for something with a flat or rounded on the top. Don't get one with a lip on the edges.
customer_reviews.author: Chris S.

customer_reviews.title: NOT ALL METAL; JUNKY AND UNSTABLE
customer_reviews.text: Description says it's "all-metal" - lie. The base is plastic and the top holder is rubber, only the shaft is metal. This things isn't worth $8.99. ITS CHEAP DOLLAR STORE JUNK. Any time I use it, it tips over.
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: Good but too short
customer_reviews.text: This really does do the job in a simple way but make sure you know the height of your headset. Based on sizing, my headsets don't really hand nicely from this because of it being relatively short. If you had one size fits all like steel series you'd be ok, but verify heits and fits before buying.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to.
customer_reviews.text: It was less than 10 dollars and holds my good headphones. I wouldn't say it's the best build quality but I can't argue for the price. It doesn't have anything that holds the 3 pieces together other than tension of the parts so you may wanna use some sort of strong adhesive when putting it together. Then again, if it's not gonna move much (and why would it) then why bother?
customer_reviews.author: Brax Dee

customer_reviews.title: Simple, sturdy, aesthetic and inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: I used my headphones and this headphone stand to test out my product photography. It's a great no-frills stand that matches my headphone's colors. Who needs gaudy LEDs all over their overpriced stand? This thing looks better for 9 bucks and takes about 20 seconds to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Great headphone stand.
customer_reviews.text: Came with complimentary items as well. UPDATE: Decided not to use anymore because it leaves marks on my headphone's band. This alters the comfort of the headphones and leaves 2 indents cause of the stand pressing into it. Nevertheless, this is still a solid headphone stand.
customer_reviews.author: Rogee

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Cool
customer_reviews.text: Does what it says, doesn't fall over when I grab my headphones off it, would be nice though if it used metal material and just that soft rubber for the mount / saddle whatever you call it. I bought it over the ones shaped like human heads because it's minimal doesn't take up much space, you don't have to bend your headphone strap to get it on there, or bend it to get it off.
customer_reviews.author: Graham Phisher

customer_reviews.title: It works well
customer_reviews.text: It's a headphone stand, so really anything less than 5 stars is not satisfactory, but this one's held up after a few months. If you want a place to hang headphones, this does that. Not fancy, but clean looking. The bar holding up the headphones is aluminum, the top where the headphones rest is some kind of silicon, the base is plastic. Easy to put together. Easy to use. If you're worried about what weight it could hold, I've rested a scanner on it, so unless you've got headphones upwards of 5-7 lbs, you should be fine. If your headphones are that heavy, you should likely find a boombox to strap to your head instead, it may be lighter.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Lohs

customer_reviews.title: Plain, so I had to make it a bit more interesting...
customer_reviews.text: It's a good stand, simple, sturdy and well made. Aluminum base and pole, rubber top. Takes a bit of force to get the rubber top into the pole, but it shouldn't be an issue. It was a bit plain for my taste, so I made things a little more interesting... (see picture)
customer_reviews.author: G_Tech

customer_reviews.title: Decent stand for the price
customer_reviews.text: Over all the quality and shape for this price is good, if you have a big headphone i don't recommend buying this unless it's wireless, else the wires will be squeezed with the table. i do have sennheiser 363d and over all not bad, anything bigger than this headset won't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Abdulaziz Farsi

customer_reviews.title: Fragile, do not buy this.
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to put together, but the first time I removed my headphones, the stand fell over and snapped at the base. Now I have a broken piece of metal and plastic. Terrible product. I would not buy it again, nor recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Hector E.

customer_reviews.title: Solid way to make your desk look fresh!
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight but supportive. Has a brand logo embossed on one side of the stand. If that ain’t your jam just spin it around and wham! Problem solved. Everyone that sees this wants it. Great for studio use or gaming definitely takes the desk/battle station to the next level.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: recommend
customer_reviews.text: If you are wanting some simple to keep your headphones stored, this is good. It needs to be a little stronger. It sometimes falls down when I am trying to get the headphones on there. Overall, for the price and size, it fits perfectly with what I needed. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria O. Ortez

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this quality stand
customer_reviews.text: Every once in a while you encounter a product that is so well executed that you take notice. This product is elegantly simple. Whoever engineered this headphone stand has an artistic minimalist eye. It is great quality and very functional. Packed tastefully with a nice understated "thank you" card. I'm impressed.
customer_reviews.author: TR

product_meta.title: Headphone Stand Headset Holder New Bee Earphone Stand with Aluminum Supporting Bar Flexible Headrest ABS Solid Base for All Headphones Size (Black)
feature_bullets: [ Compatible ] Our new bee headphone stand supports headphones of all sizes, such as Sennheiser 202 II HD598 HD 650 HD700, Dre Beats Beats Solo, Koss PortaPro, Sony MDR7506, Philips, AKG K612, Hyper X Cloud II's, Astro A50's, AT M50's, and TB 420x, Audio-Technica, etc.

[ Sturdy ] Made of aluminum headset stand and TPU rubber to provide a safe and stable foundation for your headphones. Note: when you place the headset holder on the desk please be sure the desk is flat and dust free
[ Design ] This wireless headset stand with unique and stylish design; great for home, office, studio, bedroom or next to your TV

[ Size ] The gaming headset holder about 8.85 inches height, 3.7 inches length, 3.7 inches width ,It is super easy to bring along wherever you go - it's small, light, and most important, unique fashion style
[DON'T HESITATE TO ORDER] If you have any problem or suggestion, please kindly contact us freely, we provide friendly, easy-to-reach support for you

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars5,524 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
